title: Better regulation of the immune system may minimize preeclampsia symptoms

title_detail.value: Better regulation of the immune system may minimize preeclampsia symptoms

summary: Boosting the body's levels of interleukin-4 (IL-4)--an immune system protein that controls inflammation -- may help manage the pregnancy complication preeclampsia, according to a new rodent study.

summary_detail.value: Boosting the body's levels of interleukin-4 (IL-4)--an immune system protein that controls inflammation -- may help manage the pregnancy complication preeclampsia, according to a new rodent study.
